intro: Tarenna buruensis, commonly known as the Buru tarenna, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands of Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Tarenna buruensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests.
